I have been involved in various teaching roles since early in my academic career: Adjunct Principle Instructor Teaching Assistant Adjunct Principle Instructor Between January to July 2016, I worked as an adjunct principle-instructor at Brigham Young University-Idaho in Rexburg, Idaho, USA. I was responsible for designing and implementing the course layouts, instruction, and assessments for several classes of 20-30 students each: PHYS 121, Principles of Physics 1: The first course in the calculus-based sequence of introductory physics for science majors.

These are selected, anonymous student feedback comments I’ve received about my teaching: PHYS 295 student, Fall 2017, U. of Alberta “He was always willing to help out when I needed.
